fr.upmc.datacenter.interfaces

Interface PushModeControllingI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ControlledDataOfferedI.ControlledPullI, ControlledDataRequiredI.ControlledPullI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractControlledDataInboundPort, AbstractControlledDataOutboundPort, ApplicationVM, ApplicationVMDynamicStateDataInboundPort, ApplicationVMStaticStateDataInboundPort, Computer, ComputerDynamicStateDataInboundPort, ComputerDynamicStateDataOutboundPort, ControlledDataConnector, Processor, ProcessorDynamicStateDataInboundPort, ProcessorDynamicStateDataOutboundPort

    public interface PushModeControllingI
    The interface PushModeControllingI defines the services to be implemented to control the data push services.

    Description

    Created on : September 30, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void startLimitedPushing(int interval, int n)
      start n>/code> pushing of data and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.
      void startUnlimitedPushing(int interval)
      start the pushing of data and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.
      void stopPushing()
      stop the pushing of data.

    • Method Detail

      • startUnlimitedPushing

        void startUnlimitedPushing(int interval)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        start the pushing of data and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.

        Contract

         pre    interval > 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        interval - delay between pushes (in milliseconds).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startLimitedPushing

        void startLimitedPushing(int interval,
                       int n)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        start n>/code> pushing of data and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.

        Contract

         pre    interval > 0 && n > 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        interval - delay between pushes (in milliseconds).
        n - total number of pushes to be done, unless stopped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • stopPushing

        void stopPushing()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        stop the pushing of data.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
